intro: Diosma elata, commonly known as the slender diosma, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in sagebrush steppe habitats. It has slender, branching stems with small, green, ovate leaves. Its flowers are white or pale yellow and appear in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family.
